intro: Amphicosmia kegelii, commonly known as the Kegel's orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It is characterized by its intricate floral structure, featuring two distinct types of flowers on the same inflorescence—hence its genus name "Amphicosmia," derived from the Greek words for "both" and "face." The plant produces showy, colorful blooms that range from white to pink and purple, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amphicosmia kegelii is considered a vulnerable species.
